creator: apache@pdavis.cx
text:
Lately I've been getting this exception when trying to run JSPs from within Cocoon2:

java.io.IOException: Cannot find message associated with key 'responseStream.suspended'
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.ResponseStream.flush(ResponseStream.java:237)
        at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flush(BufferedOutputStream.java:128)
        at org.apache.cocoon.reading.JSPReader.generate(JSPReader.java:105)
        ...

Looking at org/apache/catalina/connector/LocalStrings.properties, which is where the message should be, a key for "responseStream.suspended" does not 
exist.  Adding:

responseStream.suspended=The response stream has been suspended.

to that file fixes the problem.  I assume that it would also have to be added to LocalProperties_{es,jp}.properties.

Why the stream is being suspended is another issue, but I thought I'd bring this to your attention.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 7829 ***
creator: remm@apache.org
